poem.title: Social Distancing
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Bone runnels, grips and kirns, Curls of butter, curds and honey, crumbs On the breadboard. Milky tea. All those hills to climb! The asymptotic curves to flatten! Culls are a drag: the cringing curs, Seal pups and bloody clubs, When just a slice of lemon curbs the scurvy. Cousin, there comes a time 'Faut bien mourir de quelque chose' (We have to die of something). But Let's not all rush at once.
